This PR refactors the `RiskSettingsPanel` to use the reusable `ToggleSwitch` component instead of custom button implementations. This improves code maintainability and ensures consistent accessibility features (ARIA labels, keyboard focus) across the application. The `ToggleSwitch` component was also enhanced to support standard HTML attributes.

## Code Review

This pull request is a great refactoring that replaces custom toggle buttons in `RiskSettingsPanel` with a reusable and more robust `ToggleSwitch` component. The enhancement to `ToggleSwitch` to accept standard HTML attributes is a solid improvement for accessibility and reusability. However, the removal of the Playwright E2E test script `verification/verify_order_panel.py` is a concern as it may leave a gap in the visual and integration testing coverage for the order panel.

<details>
<summary>I am having trouble creating individual review comments. Click here to see my feedback.</summary>

### verification/verify_order_panel.py (1-53)

![high](https://www.gstatic.com/codereviewagent/high-priority.svg)

The removal of this Playwright script (`verify_order_panel.py`) eliminates an important end-to-end visual regression test for the order panel. This creates a gap in testing coverage, as unit tests do not cover the component's final integrated appearance and behavior in a browser. This E2E test should be restored and updated to align with the component changes, or replaced with an equivalent E2E test.

</details>
